body.name: Zalman Z1 Plus Mid Tower Gaming PC Computer Case - ATX/mATX/Mini-ITX - 3 x Pre-Installed Fans - ODD Support - Tempered Glass Side Panel, Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 3 hrs 5 mins
features: Full Mesh Front Panel: The full mesh front panel features thousands of perforations for extreme airflow and heat dissipation, ensuring your components stay cool and functioning at their best.
3x Pre-Installed Fans: Add some flair to your build with 3 pre-installed ZALMAN fans, from front to rear.

Full Tempered Glass Side Panel: Show off your build with pride, thanks to the Full Tempered Glass Side Panel. The sleek and modern design gives you a clear view of your components, while the tempered glass provides strength and durability.

Removable Magnetic Dust Filters: Maintain your system with ease thanks to the removable top and bottom panel that gives you quick access to the dust filters. Keep your system running smoothly and efficiently.

User Friendly Case I/O: Designed with the user in mind. With easy access to all your ports and buttons, connecting your peripherals has never been easier. Say goodbye to awkward angles and hard-to-reach connections.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tempered Glass side, hidden PSU cables and an ODD slot? Sign me up!
reviews.reviewText: When you have lots of Optical archive data, and NEED a DVD drive Slot in a case, you will need a case like this for a personal build. I looked at what seemed like HUNDREDS of cases and found lots with ODD bay slots, either one or 5 or something in between, hardly any had style, functionality and ease of maintenance like the Zalman Z1, I would have gone for an Antec Flux 502DP if I could have found one new for sale, it has a hidden ODD bay and swing out door. For the $69.99 price this lists for, you get 3 non-RGB fans, a high airflow case with that sexy glass side window and all the cables strategically hidden behind the motherboard and in the PSU basement. I liked this case so much I bought one for a good friends build to check the quality and was so impressed I bought another one for myself. I highly recommend this case if you want to show off the build, NEED an ODD bay for a Blu-Ray/DVD burner/Player and you don't want to spend over $80 bucks shipped to your door. It is very well built. thicker gauge steel than competitors like "Cougar" for instance. You have room for at least 2 HDD and 3 2.5 SSD drives as well. Plenty to love about this case in my opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great case for the money, and great support too.
reviews.reviewText: The first case arrived dented, but looked very good in quality, it was a shipping mishap. When I requested a replacement, the seller went out his way to make sure I was satisfied--great support for the product. The new case arrived and looked perfect, the form/fit/function of this case is one of the best I've worked with. Excellent cable troughs, good power supply compartment layout, everything fit like a glove. Plenty of room for cable routing in the case with convenient places to zip-tie them out of the way, and look nice through the window. I replaced the rear fan with a blue LED fan and the case interior lights up nicely. The system is quiet and efficient thanks to this case and it's fans. At this price, I couldn't ask for more. I am very pleased and would recommend it to a friend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble, aesthetics
reviews.reviewText: This is a regular chasis which allowed me to install two SSD and two 5.25 HHD. I'm not a gamer but my expectations were covered. No 5 stars because one of the screws that holds the glass arrived screwed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Case - Great Wire Management
reviews.reviewText: Well designed case. It has room for motherbuards with SATA connections that extend horizontally. This was built for an office application so I would have preferred 2 metal sides but Gamers will like the transparent side. It is one of the few cases including a DVD slot. There is plenty of room for wire management. It is a full sized case so make sure you have room for it. I usually use mid-tower cases but most don't offer DVD slots. The Zalman T6 is a nice mid-tower case but does not offer room for horizontal SATA connections.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not compatible with all motherboards.
reviews.reviewText: The very end slot on my MSI 990FXA board is a PCI slot that lined up OK with rear panel but I had to take my Dremel tool and modify the case by cutting a slot that was preventing my SoundBlaster XFI from lining up. Minor problem if you know how to fix it. However, this is a major flaw for the average builder.I expected far better from Zalman and NZXT since I have a Zalman CNP9900 CPU cooler that has performed flawlessly and admirably for the past 20 years. Have given it great reviews numerous times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy build, great airflow
reviews.reviewText: My last computer case had a serious dust and airflow problem, so bad that the PC would shut down due to CPU over heating. So I got this Zalman Z1 Plus case instead.It has a sturdy build and fits the hutch (PC compartment) of most computer desks. The glass side panel allows you to easily monitor the internals of your PC. There are air vents at the front, top, bottom and rear of the case, meaning great airflow and lower CPU temperature. The ports and buttons are conveniently placed at the top of the tower, so plugging in peripherals is much easier. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A nice case for those who still use optical drives.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this case solely for the optical drive bay. It is a good-looking case and very roomy. Plenty of options for fan/AIO mounting and lots of airflow.

The product is very good. It has a solid structure. It is of very good quality. The glass on the side has added a different atmosphere. There is enough space for 5 ssd/hdd and odds inside it. The cable channels are very useful.
